question: What is the name of the singer who's song was released as the lead single from the album "Confessions", and that had popular song stuck behind for eight consecutive weeks?

steps.observation: Found 4 relevant document(s): Stay (Shakespears Sister song), U Know What's Up, No One (Alicia Keys song), My Fair Lady (Broadway cast recording)

steps.thought: I'm getting the same results. Let me try retrieving one of these documents to see if any mention the Confessions album. Let me start with "No One (Alicia Keys song)" as it might have chart information.
steps.observation: "No One" is a song by American singer and songwriter Alicia Keys from her third studio album, "As I Am" (2007).  It was written and produced by Keys, Kerry Brothers Jr., and George M. Harry, and released as the album's lead single on September 11, 2007.  The song topped the "Billboard" Hot 100 for five consecutive weeks and the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart for 10 consecutive weeks, while charting inside the top 10 in most major markets.

steps.thought: This is about Alicia Keys' "As I Am" album, not "Confessions". Let me try retrieving "Stay (Shakespears Sister song)" to see if it has relevant information.
steps.observation: "Stay" is a song by UK based pop act Shakespears Sister, released by London Records in January 1992 as the second single from their album "Hormonally Yours".  Upon release, the single became a global smash hit becoming the duo's first and only No. 1 single in numerous territories, including the UK, where it topped the UK Singles Chart for eight consecutive weeks; the longest UK No. 1 reign for any all-female band, and was the fourth biggest selling single of 1992.  The single also held the No. 1 position in band member Siobhan Fahey's birthplace, Ireland, for six weeks, and it was a transatlantic hit reaching No. 4 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 in the US.

steps.thought: This mentions "Stay" was #1 for eight consecutive weeks, which matches the "eight consecutive weeks" mentioned in the question. Now I need to find what song was stuck behind it. Let me search for more specific information about what song was blocked by "Stay".

action_input.query: song stuck behind Stay Shakespears Sister eight weeks

steps.observation: Found 9 relevant document(s): Can't Touch It, Stay (Shakespears Sister song), U Know What's Up, Billy Ray Cyrus discography, I Don't Wanna Know, No One (Alicia Keys song), Feel Good Inc., Yeah! (Usher song), Stay (Sugarland song)

steps.thought: I see "Yeah! (Usher song)" in the results, which could be related to Usher's "Confessions" album. Let me retrieve that document.
steps.observation: "Yeah!"  is a song by American singer Usher.  He co-wrote the song with Sean Garrett, Patrick J. Que Smith, Robert McDowell, LRoc, Ludacris, Da'Ron, and Lil Jon.  It also features guest vocals from Lil Jon and Ludacris, with the former also producing the song as well as incorporating crunk and R&B—which he coined as crunk&B—in the song's production.  The song was released as the lead single from Usher's fourth studio album "Confessions" (2004) on January 27, 2004, after Usher was told by Arista Records, his label at the time, to record more tracks for the album.

steps.thought: Perfect! "Yeah!" by Usher was the lead single from the album "Confessions". Now I need to find out what song was stuck behind "Yeah!" for eight consecutive weeks. Let me search for more information about "Yeah!" and its chart performance.

action_input.query: Yeah Usher song stuck behind eight weeks

steps.observation: Found 9 relevant document(s): Can't Touch It, Stay (Shakespears Sister song), U Know What's Up, Billy Ray Cyrus discography, I Don't Wanna Know, No One (Alicia Keys song), Feel Good Inc., Yeah! (Usher song), Stay (Sugarland song)

steps.thought: Let me try retrieving "I Don't Wanna Know" as it might have information about being blocked by "Yeah!".
steps.observation: "I Don't Wanna Know" is a song by American R&B artist Mario Winans, featuring a rap by P. Diddy, re-recorded background vocals by Enya and sampling the synthesizer riff from Enya's song "Boadicea".  It reached number 1 in the United Kingdom and in Netherlands, and number 2 in the United States, stuck for eight consecutive weeks behind the Usher singles "Yeah" and "Burn", respectively.  It remains Winans' only major success to date.  As a result of its eight weeks at number 2, "I Don't Wanna Know" stands in joint fifth place for the most weeks at number 2 by a song which did not go to number 1, behind Foreigner's "Waiting for a Girl Like You", Missy Elliott's "Work It", Donna Lewis's "I Love You Always Forever" and Shania Twain's "You're Still the One".

steps.thought: Perfect! I found the answer. "I Don't Wanna Know" by Mario Winans was stuck at #2 for eight consecutive weeks, blocked by Usher's singles "Yeah!" and "Burn". Since "Yeah!" was the lead single from "Confessions", and the question asks about the singer whose song was the lead single from "Confessions" that kept another song stuck behind for eight consecutive weeks, the answer is Usher.
steps.observation: Task completed. Final answer: Usher

Upon release, the single became a global smash hit becoming the duo's first and only No. 1 single in numerous territories, including the UK, where it topped the UK Singles Chart for eight consecutive weeks; the longest UK No. 1 reign for any all-female band, and was the fourth biggest selling single of 1992. steps.thought: This song topped the charts but doesn't mention being stuck behind another song. Let me check "U Know What's Up" next.
steps.observation: "U Know What's Up" is a 1999 hit song by singer-songwriter-producer Donell Jones' second studio album, "Where I Wanna Be".  The song features Lisa Lopes of TLC.  It reached number one on the Billboard Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Singles & Tracks chart on November 13, 1999, and stayed at number one for eight consecutive weeks.  It peaked at number seven on the Billboard Hot 100, remaining there for two consecutive weeks.  Outside the United States, the song peaked within the top ten of the charts in the United Kingdom.  The song was produced by Edward "Eddie F" Ferrell and Darren Lighty for Untouchables Entertainment.  It is Jones's biggest hit to date.  The song was co-written by Anthony Hamilton.  The songs serves as the opening track on LaFace Records.

steps.thought: This song reached number one on the R&B chart for eight consecutive weeks, but I still need to find which song was stuck *behind* another song. Let me check the last document about "My Fair Lady."
steps.observation: The Broadway cast recording of the musical My Fair Lady was released as an album on April 2, 1956.  The songs were composed by Frederick Loewe with lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner and conducted by Franz Allers, while the cast included stars Julie Andrews and Rex Harrison.  The album became a massive seller, topping the charts on the US "Billboard" 200 for fifteen weeks at different times in 1956 (eight consecutive weeks), 1957, 1958 and 1959.  In the UK, upon its release in 1958, the album reached No.1 for 19 consecutive weeks and became the biggest-selling album of the year.  The album was released on Columbia Records, whose President, Goddard Lieberson provided the $375,000 needed to stage the show in return for the rights to the Cast recording.  The album was later re-issued on Compact disc in 1988 and has been re-released a number of times since.  It is currently available with bonus tracks.

steps.observation: "No One" is a song by American singer and songwriter Alicia Keys from her third studio album, "As I Am" (2007).  It was written and produced by Keys, Kerry Brothers Jr., and George M. Harry, and released as the album's lead single on September 11, 2007.  The song topped the "Billboard" Hot 100 for five consecutive weeks and the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart for 10 consecutive weeks, while charting inside the top 10 in most major markets.

steps.thought: This document is about Alicia Keys' "No One" which topped charts, but it doesn't mention being stuck behind another song for eight weeks. Let me check the "Stay (Shakespears Sister song)" document as it might contain information about blocking other songs.
steps.observation: "Stay" is a song by UK based pop act Shakespears Sister, released by London Records in January 1992 as the second single from their album "Hormonally Yours".  Upon release, the single became a global smash hit becoming the duo's first and only No. 1 single in numerous territories, including the UK, where it topped the UK Singles Chart for eight consecutive weeks; the longest UK No. 1 reign for any all-female band, and was the fourth biggest selling single of 1992.  The single also held the No. 1 position in band member Siobhan Fahey's birthplace, Ireland, for six weeks, and it was a transatlantic hit reaching No. 4 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 in the US.

steps.thought: This document mentions "Stay" topped the UK chart for eight consecutive weeks, but I need to find what song was stuck behind it. Let me check "U Know What's Up" to see if it contains relevant information about the Confessions album.
steps.observation: "U Know What's Up" is a 1999 hit song by singer-songwriter-producer Donell Jones' second studio album, "Where I Wanna Be".  The song features Lisa Lopes of TLC.  It reached number one on the Billboard Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Singles & Tracks chart on November 13, 1999, and stayed at number one for eight consecutive weeks.  It peaked at number seven on the Billboard Hot 100, remaining there for two consecutive weeks.  Outside the United States, the song peaked within the top ten of the charts in the United Kingdom.  The song was produced by Edward "Eddie F" Ferrell and Darren Lighty for Untouchables Entertainment.  It is Jones's biggest hit to date.  The song was co-written by Anthony Hamilton.  The songs serves as the opening track on LaFace Records.

steps.observation: "Yeah!"  is a song by American singer Usher.  He co-wrote the song with Sean Garrett, Patrick J. Que Smith, Robert McDowell, LRoc, Ludacris, Da'Ron, and Lil Jon.  It also features guest vocals from Lil Jon and Ludacris, with the former also producing the song as well as incorporating crunk and R&B—which he coined as crunk&B—in the song's production.  The song was released as the lead single from Usher's fourth studio album "Confessions" (2004) on January 27, 2004, after Usher was told by Arista Records, his label at the time, to record more tracks for the album.

steps.observation: "Stay" is a song by UK based pop act Shakespears Sister, released by London Records in January 1992 as the second single from their album "Hormonally Yours".  Upon release, the single became a global smash hit becoming the duo's first and only No. 1 single in numerous territories, including the UK, where it topped the UK Singles Chart for eight consecutive weeks; the longest UK No. 1 reign for any all-female band, and was the fourth biggest selling single of 1992.  The single also held the No. 1 position in band member Siobhan Fahey's birthplace, Ireland, for six weeks, and it was a transatlantic hit reaching No. 4 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 in the US.

steps.observation: "I Don't Wanna Know" is a song by American R&B artist Mario Winans, featuring a rap by P. Diddy, re-recorded background vocals by Enya and sampling the synthesizer riff from Enya's song "Boadicea".  It reached number 1 in the United Kingdom and in Netherlands, and number 2 in the United States, stuck for eight consecutive weeks behind the Usher singles "Yeah" and "Burn", respectively.  It remains Winans' only major success to date.  As a result of its eight weeks at number 2, "I Don't Wanna Know" stands in joint fifth place for the most weeks at number 2 by a song which did not go to number 1, behind Foreigner's "Waiting for a Girl Like You", Missy Elliott's "Work It", Donna Lewis's "I Love You Always Forever" and Shania Twain's "You're Still the One".
